article_title: Update: All main lanes of northbound Central Expressway open after major crash involving 18-wheeler, fuel spill
article_text:
Update at 7:47 p.m.: All main lanes of northbound Central Expressway have reopened, more than 4 hours after an accident involving a semi-truck

No injuries were reported.

Update at 6:01 p.m.: More than two hours after the crash was reported, at least one lane on northbound Central Expressway at Walnut Hill has reopened.

However, traffic appears to be backed up for miles, so it may be best to avoid that area if possible.

Original post: Dallas police are investigating an accident that shut down northbound Central Expressway at Walnut Hill Lane Saturday afternoon.

According to the Texas Department of Transportation, the accident, which involved a diesel truck leaking fuel, happened around 3:30 p.m.

Dallas Fire-Rescue’s HazMat team is at the scene.

More details to come.

However, traffic appears to be backed up for miles, so it may be best to avoid that area if possible.
According to the Texas Department of Transportation, the accident, which involved a diesel truck leaking fuel, happened around 3:30 p.m.Dallas Fire-Rescue’s HazMat team is at the scene.
